author: sky.cactus
content: This isn't an appropriate server for this kind of content.  If you have a line of research you are interested in pursuing, posting relevant images is reasonable.  However it isn't appropriate to post random images of charts in this server.

author: sky.cactus
content: This type of content also isn't appropriate for this server.  <@&595685821026271242> this smells relatively strongly of shilling as well.

author: Deleted User
content:
Thanks for your response, Micah.
The line of research that I‚Äôm actively pursuing is analyzing the effect that EIP-1559 has had on ETH supply. And since AFAIK only one other source besides me is following the supply inflation rate (and IMO that other source is doing so wrongly by disregarding PoS issuance), that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm plotting my own charts using data from a trustworthy source: Etherscan.
Although this Discord server is focused on development, I thought that maybe the developers who worked on EIP-1559 might be interested in seeing the tangible result of their work on ETH supply.
But if you still think that the charts that I shared are ‚Äúrandom images‚Äù, I‚Äôll be more than happy to delete that post and refrain from posting any more in the future.
Thanks again.

author: sky.cactus
content: Generally speaking, this server focuses on technical changes and not on economic changes.  Any change in ETH supply is a side effect of improving/aligning incentives, but it isn't a primary target (other than achieving minimum viable issuance).  Also, <#692078615269212180> is a more appropriate place to discuss the effects of EIP-1559, but again with a focus on end-user UX rather than holder financial prospects.

author: Deleted User
content: Understood, Micah. I will stop posting these charts here. Cheers.
